summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 discussing coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) and the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program regarding the inclusion of FBI contact information in materials for victims. The emails show internal FBI review processes and the impending launch of the compensation program.

persons.name: Henderson
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC communicating with the FBI Victim Services Division about including FBI contact information in materials for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the victims' compensation program and ongoing investigation; his estate is referenced in the email subject.

connections.description: Henderson, as a trial attorney, is involved with the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, indicating a professional connection to Epstein's case and estate.

events.title: Launch of Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is scheduled to begin, with final materials being prepared for victims.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was scheduled to launch on June 25, 2020.
The program intended to include FBI Victim Services Division contact information in materials provided to victims.
Internal FBI review processes required statements about Epstein to be vetted by NY EM, CDC, SDNY, OGC, and OPA due to the case's scrutiny.
The email chain shows coordination between a private attorney (Henderson) and the FBI regarding victim outreach and services.
